pullRequest.body:
add definition of equidecomposition and some basic theory and operations.

TODO:

Prove that if two sets embeddidecompose into eachother, they are equidecomposable (Schroeder-Bernstein type theorem)
Define embeddidecomposability as a Preorder on sets and prove that its induced equivalence relation is equidecomposability.
Prove the definition of equidecomposition used here is equivalent to the more familiar one using partitions. This equivalence is trivial mathematically, but partitions do not seem well-developed to me in mathlib.

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...


Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.01)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|107|1|bare open (scoped) Classical|

Current commit [2e5e7b5002](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/2e5e7b5002cb94d9cbda9e7119c9adc6a132e9e7)
Reference commit [165731857a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/165731857a079f3712426d4d1da2a5ac32c6be56)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Thanks for taking a look and fixing the merge conflict!

add todo list

```suggestion

## TODO

* Prove that if two sets embeddidecompose into eachother, they are equidecomposable (Schroeder-Bernstein type theorem)
* Define embeddidecomposability as a Preorder on sets and prove that its induced equivalence relation is equidecomposability.
* Prove the definition of equidecomposition used here is equivalent to the more familiar one using partitions.

```

this should be private since it's specifically used to define Equidecomp and is otherwise not useful on its own.

(if it does get useful later, it's an easier transition from private to public than vice versa).

Hmm ok. Is it still OK that `DecompOn` appears in the definition of `Equidecomp`, though? Or should the definition of `Equidecomp` be changed to use the unfolded form of `DecompOn`, and `DecompOn` be used only internally to this file?
If it does stay in the definition, I suppose I should instead provide alternate constructors and elminators (?) for `Equidecomp` using the unfolded version?

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Group/Action): add definition of equidecomposition
